data: The Intercamp2016: Meet&Support is taking place in Loerrach, Germany together with the Nations of Italy, Austria, the UK, Poland and Turkey.Youth is looking ahead, tennegers and young adults have to find common values, nowadays especially when it comes to refugees.46 young humans from these Nations, their host country Germany and newly arrived refugees are coming together to MEET -- new languages, cultures, handling conflicts, understanding, intercultural and social competences.Their SUPPORT -- taking place in our refugee centers. Knowledge about stories, circumstances, collaborating in ideas, participation, decision making, to show solidarity and taking on a personal standing, are the central aspekts of this part. Here, real and feasable support for our refugees shall be the result.These aims and outcomes, plus the personal development each participant is taking "home", are multipliers of their values. The impression in this as well as in other countries will be a very enriching voice towards Europe.
Krajobraz na miarę XXI wieku - nowoczesność, harmonia i funkcjonalność

The project includes a 2-week professional practice for 2 groups of 30 students preparing them for the profession of landscape architecture technician.
The project was planned for a period of 12 months counting from July 2014 to June 2015, students will take part in professional work practice, which will be organized by a modern and well-equipped 14Plus Pathways LTD located in Chester. The above mentioned institution, where students will take their practice, is engaged in vocational training in the construction industry in the broad meaning of the term, including  the area of landscape architecture. It has the most recent machinery, equipment, computer programs and workstations currently used to study the profession of landscape architecture technician .
Preparation of the practice results from the need to enhance professional competence of future landscape architects , due to the booming job market in this field.
One of the projects's main assumptions is enabling participants to master skills and knowledge most desired in the labor market in the field of road design based on concrete and natural stone paving in the historic and modern landscape architecture . Additionally, the participants will become familiar with new computer programs and technical devices used in architecture. They will enhance practical skills involved in making measurements with use of modern surveyor equipment, including devices using laser techniques, establishment of roads and paths in gardens and parks, fitting the paving stone, designing sites using decorative pavement. In the course of performance of practical tasks, which will take as much as 80 % of the whole time they will learn flexibility in finding solutions to architectural issues and challenges emerging-to-date as well as master the skills of decision-making regarding the use of optimal work techniques.
The project aims at multi-dimensional development of students. Apart from developing practical competences they will have the opportunity to compare technologies and tools used in the British landscape architecture, which stands on a very high level in many areas and is perceived as trend-setter and is used as a reference to solutions used in Poland. Students will also explores the UK labor market and its needs in the field of landscape architecture.
Thanks to common activities with British students participants will not only broaden  professional vocabulary in English (which will greatly facilitate their subsequent professional contacts with employers, customers, contractors), but also will develop their language in everyday communication situations. All of these experiences will be ready to use in their further education and career.
Acquired skills will be confirmed by certificates, which will also constitute additional advantage of participant in their search for jobs on the international labor market.
We have planned extensive promotion of the project in the region, including  publications in the local media and on the website of our school. Students participating in the project will exchange their experiences with other students of our school during the special workshops in the course of the project's summary as well as with students and teachers of other schools and other institutions of the same profile. Professional practice in the UK, apart from strictly professional and linguistic skills will also give participants the opportunity to explore the culture and sights of the host country, broaden their perception of the world and the surrounding environment. Furthermore it will develop their social competences and personality including appropriate responding to stressful situations , ability to work in a group, self-critical assessment of their work .
Practice will take place between 20.09.2014 - 04.10.2014 and 21.04.2015r. - 04.04.2015r.  in Chester.

Farndon Primary School is a one form entry rural school on the outskirts of the historical city of Chester, in the NW of England. It caters for children aged 3 -11 and benefits from an on site before and after school club and a school-run Nursery. There are 217 pupils and 34 members of staff. We are extremely proud of our school and the way that everyone works together to create such a warm and caring environment and a happy place to learn. We believe that education should be an exciting journey and our aim is that every child leaves our school with a love of learning that will remain with them throughout their lives.  From  September 2015, MFL became a focus on the school development plan and following an audit, a shortfall of staff confidence and expertise was identified.  We decided to apply for funding through the Erasmus+ Programme to help us fulfill the requirements of the new curriculum. Participating in this project, will further enhance our thematic curriculum and help to develop positive attitudes to foreign language  and enhance intercultural awareness. Eight members of staff will participate in the Erasmus+ programme and attend  immersion courses in France over a two year  period, provided by PQ France.We envisage the  expected impact to be far reaching.- MFL lead will have a clear rational for the subject within school, supporting colleagues, implementing a curriculum that is both engaging and clearly shows a progression of the skills.- Staff will have increased knowledge, skills and confidence in the teaching of French within their classrooms.- Colleagues will have received quality professional development through effective and well planned dissemination from participants. They will have access to relevant and quality resources and the use of a comprehensive curriculum.- Pupils will benefit from this project as our school encompasses a European dimension to its themed based topics.  - Pupils will have skilled, enthusiastic staff teaching them French, enabling them to develop their skills in all four areas of the new curriculum. - We will be involved in a network of like -minded schools, sharing ideas, resources and good practice through regular meetings.  - In global learning twilights, the benefit of participating in the Erasmus project, adding a European dimension to our curriculum, can be shared with our partner school.We see this, our first Erasmus+ project as a springboard for future links with France, partnership projects and possible pupil exchanges.

In the city of Cádiz, some main handicaps have been detected: the high youth unemployment, the lack of expectations, the high level of school leaving and the low foreign language achievement, all this restrict the future professional development of our students and determinate a clear need of putting into practice  tools aimed to acquisition of competences that allow them being involved with options of future, inside the labor market. The need of open up opportunities to our students to other possibilities confirm that this project can help to improve their linguistic competences and in fact their prospection to Europe. Similarly we would like to point out the role that this project as a  driver of transfer of knowledge, trough the chance of receiving expert from companies that will contribute their knowledge and background into areas as a the Quality and lasted technologies.

 The Consortium is formed by the Cádiz City Council  plus seven vocational centers of our city: Drago High School, Salesianos San Ignacio School, San Severiano High School, Columela High School, Alberti High School, Cornelio Balbo High School, Fernando Quiñones High School. Nowadays the Consortium is carrying out two ERASMUS+ project, making possible a total of 95 mobilities. The new Consortium  formed for  Erasmus+ 2017 call, two  vocational centers has been added: Fernando Aguilar Quignon High School and María Inmaculada High School, so that the new Consortium is formed by a total of nine High Schools (being 10 High Schools what we counted  in Cádiz).

The Project will be developed within 24 months and will participate 71 youths, 58 intermediate vocational students and 13 recent qualified experts and carry out two types of stays in Italy, Czech Republic,  Ireland, United Kingdom, Germany, Portugal, Greece and Malta:

-          Stays in Training Centers or workplace training over a period from 3 to 6 months for recent qualified experts older than 18 years old, and should have finished their VET studies within one year.

-          Complete workplace training for intermediate Vocational Education and Training students, older than 16 years old and must have passed all the technical modules of training cycle and providing certain degree of personal maturity, carrying out during 3 months for acquisition of competences attached to each cycle.

Students Mobilities Schedule:

15.03.2018 - 15.06.2018: United Kingdom (3 FCT); Italy (4  FCT); Ireland (3 FCT);  Germany (3 FCT);  Malta (4 FCT), Czech Republic (4 FCT), Greece (4 FCT) Portugal (4 FCT)

01.09.2018 - 30-12.2018:  Italy (2 RG);  Portugal (2RG); Malta (3 RG) Ireland (2 RG) Greece (2 RG), 

01.07.2018 – 30.01.2019: Czech Republic (2 RG)

15.03.2019 - 15.06.2019: United Kingdom (3 FCT); Italy (4  FCT); Ireland (3 FCT);  Germany (3 FCT);  Malta (4 FCT), Czech Republic (4 FCT), Greece (4 FCT) Portugal (4 FCT)

Additionally, 14 teachers will take part of the mobilities including training stays and job shadowing in Training Centers in Holland and Croatia to exchange good practice methods and way to do. Also, 5 experts` mobilities, of 4/5 days stays,  from Ireland, United Kingdom  and Greece Companies that will training in Vocational Education Centers. 

The members of the Consortium will establish a cooperative methodology, and will create on one hand a Steering Committee formed by persons responsible from each vocational center and IFEF in order to verify the project quality management and in the other hand in each vocational center a  Mobility Committee that will directly coordinate with the IFEF Management Team and with European partner in the preparation knowledge, selection and mo
The members of the Consortium will establish a cooperative methodology, and will create on one hand a Steering Committee formed by persons responsible from each vocational center and IFEF in order to verify the project quality management and in the other hand in each vocational center a  Mobility Committee that will directly coordinate with the IFEF Management Team and with European partner in the preparation knowledge, selection and monitoring stages of the participants mobilities.

The expected impact on the students will mean an improvement of the training and achievement; In short to medium term, we expect regenerate an incentive dynamic  of entrepreneurial attitude and the students mobilities, improving the academics results and reducing the school living. On the vocational center will mean an enhancement of the educational quality, making a effort of adapting to the new needs, contributing to create a new European culture with the consequence social impact that involve foreign mobilities, to the improvement of the curriculum project of the training cycles and creation of networks. As well, a expect impact on the host partner  will mean a improvement of the procedures and methodologies within  the company or Educational training by knowing first-hand different ways of doing and working.

Ashton Hayes Primary School is a smaller than average primary school located in a rural area of Cheshire West and Chester. Attainment on entry to Reception Class is generally at or below expected levels of attainment.  Children leave the school attaining levels above the national average - for the academic year 2013-14 Ashton Hayes was in the top 10 performing schools in the Authority.

As well as the Headteacher there are 7 teachers, 8 Teaching Assistants, 2 Office Staff, 7 Midday Supervisors and two Kitchen Staff.  We have a degree level trained Teaching Assistant who delivers French to all age-groups from 4 years old. The Headteacher has previous experience of creating a link with a French school and is keen to develop this practice in this organisation.

At present, there is one teacher who delivers French Language lessons to the whole school. With the introduction of the new curriculum, we would like to increase the capacity of teachers to deliver language and cultural studies.

The objectives for the project are as follows:

- Improve language skills
- Further understanding of European Culture and lifestyles.
- Improved professional development of staff.
- Confidence to deliver language and cultural lessons in a variety of contexts.

There will be five participants who will visit France over the project period of two years and learn about French culture and language.

Participants will increase their understanding of French culture and improve their language skills to develop their practice in delivering Modern Foreign Languages and Cultures in school.  Their class will benefit from the knowledge gained by their class teacher and will in turn improve their language skills and their understanding of French culture. Colleagues in school will be trained by the participants and therefore extend the numbers of language teachers across the school giving the children more opportunities to practice and develop their language and cultural skills.  All children will improve their language skills and their understanding of European cultures.  

Network and cluster schools will be invited to hear feedback from the project and the Lead Teachers will present the impact of the project at a cluster meeting.  Parents will be invited to attend a French Day in School to work alongside the children and participants in follow-up work from the project.  Governors will also be invited to attend the Parent Day and the Link governor for Modern  Foreign Languages will review the project and report to the Governing Body.

Ashton Hayes Primary School has a vision that in the medium term term (5 years), the children will develop as confident, emerging language learners. We wish to develop their skills and ensure that they progress to secondary school well-rounded European citizens.
